experiences.title: Undergraduate Learning Assistant
experiences.subtitle: Department of Statistics and Probability, Michigan State University
workDescription: Assigned to the introductory class for the Statistics and Data Science majors, STT 180 (Introduction to Data Science after being selected from a large pool of applicants.

Involved assisting the instructional team with the administration course, grading of objective course assesment materials, leading help rooms, and providing in-class assistance to students with R coding problems.

experiences.title: Undergraduate Researcher
experiences.subtitle: Bhattacharya Lab, Institute for Quantitative Health Sciences, Michigan State University
workDescription: Completed a one-on-one research experience under Dr. Sudin Bhattacharya, Associate Professor at the College of Engineering (BME) and the Department of Pharmacology and Toxicology.
Studied extensive literature in ordinary differential equations, anatomy, liver zonation and diseases, and computational biology.

Worked with computational modeling tools like CompuCell3D and Tellurium on Python to build on existing digital models of the human liver, and eventually construct agent-based models to simulate biological processes.

experiences.title: Researcher, Discover America Exchange Program
experiences.subtitle: Department of Mathematics, Michigan State University
workDescription: Studied and analyzed a paper under Dr. Yijun Zuo, Professor of Statistics and Probability, titled 'Robust penalized least squares of depth trimmed regression for high-dimensional data', while understanding specific topics covered by the paper.
Presented my studies at the 21st Annual Mathematics Conference.
Contributed to the social aspect of the program by leading and supporting a cohort of exchange students as a chaperone during their spring break trip.

experiences.title: Professorial Assistant
experiences.subtitle: Michigan State University Honors College
workDescription: Appointed as a Professorial Assistant to Dr. Matt Grossmann, Director of the Institute of Public Policy and Social Research (IPPSR) and Professor of Political Science.
Analyzed demographics by comparing relevant trends and their relation to policy-making using R while developing recommendations to advance inclusion in legislatures.
Presented at MSU’s 9th Annual Diversity Research Showcase alongside nearly 50 other students and received the Award for Research at the Preliminary Stage.
